Instruction: Heat up the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Use cooking spray to grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Cut bread rolls horizontally without pulling apart into individual rolls, forming two even halves.
Combine the beaten eggs with milk, cinnamon, and vanilla extract in a shallow bowl to create a smooth batter for dipping.

Immerse the bottom half of the bread rolls in the batter, ensuring both sides are coated, and arrange them in the baking dish. Layer sliced bananas over the bread. Sprinkle brown sugar and pecans on top, then add cubes of butter. Submerge the top half of the bread rolls in the batter, ensuring both sides are coated, and place them on top.
Bake in the oven until the center is set and the top is golden brown, approximately 25 minutes.
Top off if desired with brown sugar and chopped pecans for an added crunchy texture.
